result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles D Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is granted a payment plan.  Defendant is to pay $50.00 per month beginning October 1, 2015 or spend 30 days in jail, consecutive.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles D Anderson

records.addlTxt: Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served

Defendant Charles D Anderson in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Charles D Anderson in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.  States offer-plea to charge state would rec 90 days RCJ.  Judge conducts plea colloquey.  P-G and is found G by the court.  
BTC:  90 days RCJ with CFTS.  DNA surcharge and cc and assessments  PPP $50 per month beginning 10/1/15 ftp is 30 days in jail cons.
Plea hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 12, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Charles D Anderson in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Charles D Anderson in custody.  Noah Michael Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
State calls Officer Seeger, DSAT
Defendant does not stipulate to prior convictions. 
State moves for bind over. Defense objects and moves for dismissal. 
Defense requests bond modification. State objects. 
BTC: Court does find prior convictions are valid. Motion to dismiss is denied. Testimony given, probable cause found,  bound over. Bond modification is denied. 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  ***ALSO $4,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND***   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Charles D Anderson in court with attorney Keith David O'Donnell.  Defendant Charles D Anderson in custody.  Eric P. Guttenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.
